text: This place was good I got the lavender cotton candy for my kids and they didn't like it because it smelled like fabulouso and I got the earl tea which was pretty good but the thing that stuck out was the butterscotch latte the hubby loved it!!

This is now my favorite cafe.
music is nice , nice decor.
People working here are very friendly .
I got Greentea Raindrop & Scarlet iced Tea

Everything was so good I will be back!

Vacationed in Vegas for 3 days and I found myself lounging at Loftti 3 days in a row.
Their drinks were fabulous, Matcha Lotti and Golden Lychee especially so. And their desserts, Raindrops and Early Cotton candys, were also solid. (pun intended) If I had lived in Vegas I would have frequented this place without a doubt. 
On top of their superb desserts and drinks, kind staffs and really cool ambiance convinced me to give them 5 stars. 

I'm waiting for Loftti to open up LA branch already.

Loftti has modern and also classic decoration that goes really well. Every teas are in high quality and the prices are very reasonable. Try the earlgray milk tea, its the best milk tea i ever had in my life.

The cool part is the location...its a bit invisible but once you enter it's very cozy...i really enjoy the kind people here. The menu is very good with excellent teas and desserts...I think it is the chillest coffee/tea spot in las vegas

Actually first discovered this place through a friend of mine and I've been coming back since. I usually come here to study; atmosphere is cozy and quiet. The interior of the café is modern and artsy. I ordered a vanilla chai latte with boba, it's decent. The staff are nice and knowledgeable.

Hidden on Rainbow & Robindale where Ice Monster used to be is this super cute tea shop! I'm in love with the hipster interior and ambiance here and will probably be back to study! Unfortunately the drinks aren't anything too special to me or anything that I'll ever crave. The Honey Black tea tastes like most milk teas from boba shops. The signature ice teas were good but nothing that makes them stand out. Great customer service and nice ladies working though! Will be back to try the frozen cotton candy.
Worst customer service!!! Never going back there. The lady at the cash register was so rude.

This little cafe is so cute! Tried the matcha and lychee strawberry raindrop dessert, which both were refreshing and great for a light snack. Their drink selection is unique so I asked for recommendations. Staff is very sweet and answered all of my questions.

Great location
Great interior
Theres great choice of drinks to choose from

Very relaxing
Free WiFi. It ain't just fast, it's Usain Bolt fast. Probably one of the best chillaxing place I've ever been.

We finally got around to checking this place out tonight and I'm so glad we did...we both had the mocha cotton candy and also tried the lychee strawberry raindrop....so amazing! We will definitely be back to try some more ! The employees were also super nice and atmosphere is super relaxing..

A cafe with a very chill and relaxed ambience. The menu has a good variety, and out of the six drinks we tried, we weren't disappointed. We tried a mango smoothie, banana frozen latti, matcha latti, caramel latti, and from their signature teas: Emerald and Scarlett. We also tried the raindrop dessert and it's unique and something to definitely try, but maybe only once. The prices are very reasonable and I'm excited to try more! Oh, and the staff is very nice!

This place is so unique to Vegas. It is in a corner of a shopping center hiding so it doesn't get too busy, but everything is great!

RAINDROP CAKE: I was on a mission to discover these bad boys. Everyone talks about it and takes pictures, but my mind was questioning it so much. These cakes are water based made with a japanese mix. It is very light in flavor and it is basically a tasteless gelatin. It is best to order it was something to give it flavor. I highly recommend trying the lychee and strawberry raindrop cake. The lychee and strawberry is actually inside the raindrop cake. It is served with a strawberry sauce and a chocolate sauce. This dish has an acquired taste, but it doesn't hurt to try it. I personally really enjoy it being super light in flavor.

FROZEN COTTON CANDY: This was another mysterious dessert. I still have no idea what frozen cotton candy means, but all I know is that it is delicious! You can pick from various flavors like lavender, earl grey, chocolate, and more. The lavender is a great choice for people who like lavender. It has strong flavor and is served with cotton candy on top.***

***UPDATE: The coffee frozen cotton candy is my absolute favorite item on their menu!
Amazing smoothies! I definitely recommend the white coconut with boba. Definitely coming back service was awesome and the the ambience is great. Really good vibes there!
I tired the rain drop dessert looks cool but doesn't taste that great. The fruity tea I order was also watere

The best lychee tea and desserts! Service was impeccable and they were so helpful explaining all their teas.
Beautiful trendy setting 
Will come back for sure

I tried their Emerald Green tea and it was pretty good. Atmosphere is very nice. Place has only been opened for a month so I'm expecting a lot of new things that will be coming. I wish they had pastries or some kind of food to eat with your drink. I'll definitely come back.

I had this place bookmarked for awhile now and the fams and I finally had a chance to come by.  The cafe is located on the side of a strip mall so it was a bit hard for us to find at first, but we found it ;) The cafe itself was pretty nice and cozy with a good amount of seating areas.  Cafe is perfect to bring your laptop to study, do some work, while having a nice cup of coffee or treat.

Now I can't comment on their coffee or lattes but we did try their frozen cotton candy and raindrop - which were the 2 main reasons why we came. The frozen cotton candy is pretty much a shaved snow drink topped with cotton candy. The cotton candy topping was pretty huge, looked like a piece of cloud floating on top of my cup. I honestly had no clue how to dig into my drink but my kids were happy to help me devour it. The cotton candy itself was pretty much that..cotton candy but I really enjoyed my drink. I love how it was perfectly balanced and not overly sweet. I would definitely come back for this and try the other flavors they offer.

On the other hand, the raindrop, I wasn't too impressed with it. Don't get me wrong, it definitely looks pretty cool and picture worthy which is why the husband wanted to get it. But it was pretty much non flavored gelatin with strawberries and lychee jelly. If you got a piece of the jello itself, it tastes like nothing. But I give them 5 stars on presentation but we probably won't be getting this again. 

If you are wanting something a bit unique, I would definitely recommend stopping by here. The BFams will definitely be back.

I came in late at night with a friend for a late night study session. I previously worked for a small locally owned business and I can honestly say that employees like Mark (with braces) the barista who helped us are exactly what keeps locals coming back. The experience of interacting with enthusiastic and genuine staff that know the product and care about the customers are what makes me take the time to come here with friends instead of the local Starbucks. Overall I love coming here for the tasty drinks, friends staff, and good study environment.

Such a cute coffee shop. I loved the interior design and the vibe here. It was pretty quiet with great acoustic tunes in the background.  They had free WiFi and a bunch of drink options. Prices were slightly high, but that's what you get at these fancier coffee shops. I will definitely be back soon!

It's OK. I ordered the matcha latti and immediately took a sip of sugar. That's after swirling my cup a few times. When I got home, there was still a lot of sugar in my cup. If you like loads of sugar, this is for you. In my case, I did not like all that sugar. 

Next I ordered the shaved ice. It's not frozen cotton candy. I guess I was expecting something like CottonHi in LA. I guess it was my mistake for not asking what it's made with. It's basically shaved ice. I think it's milk ice that they shave. Then they put green tea ice cream and condensed milk in the bottom in layers. 

I love the way they designed the place. Very nice place to study with the classical music playing in the background. The ladies who work their are very friendly and polite. I'll add a star for these reasons. 

Will I come back, probably not. Thanks for the experience, it's just not for me :)

I use this place primarily as a place to hang out first and get drinks second -- the atmosphere is so calming and relaxing that it's a perfect place to catch up with friends or study. As I'm more of a tea drinker, I can't really speak for the coffee or specialties, but I've liked the teas they've offered there. The employees there are sweet and accommodating and you always feel welcome.

Another new cafe in town to check out located on the SW corner of Rainbow & Robindale, in the same location where 'Ice Monster' used to be, behind Dairy Queen, around the corner from Goong. 

Completely re-decorated, playing some quiet gentle orchestral music. Has a "hipster" kind of feel with the hanging lightbulbs with long filaments, dimly lighting the environment, and shelves with various decor

First time i came here, was after dinner so I was not able to order anything. 2 of my friends ordered the booming dessert world-wide "raindrop cake dessert" which consists of a clear slightly sweet gelatin to resemble a raindrop, accompanied by a sweet syrup and powder on the side. They have two selections (original or green tea). Original is with a roasted soybean powder, green tea is with a matcha powder. Interesting style of dessert. Pretty decent but the syrup can be a bit sweet. 

Their main menu on the wall behind the cashier consists of classic teas, fruity teas, signature iced teas, latti, frozen latti, real fruit smoothie, frozen cotten candy (shaved ice), and others 

Second time i had came here, i had tried the matcha frozen latti. not sure what i was expecting but it tasted like a green tea frappachino, maybe a little thinner and not as thick as one from like starbucks. 

Environment is nice and quiet for the most part. Decent amount of small tables for small parties. Only 1 large table but has seating fairly spread apart. Seats are quite uncomfortable. 

Maybe will try their hot drinks in the future or teas. Not exactly sure why i got a frozen drink xD
Love this place! I do my homework here all the time and the atmosphere is very calm. The drinks are great and the customer service has always been good. I'll be back next week lol

LOVE LOVE LOVE their teas! We got the Golden Lychee tea w/ boba, Blush tea w/ boba & the Pomegranate Oolong tea. The teas were super fresh and not watery, the boba was soft and chewy (so you know it was fresh!) I finished my drink so quickly, I was sad that I didn't order two!

Saw this place on IG and decided to come see what the rain drop cake was all about!

It was basically a clear tasteless jello flavored with peanut Mochi powder and brown sugar syrup that you mix yourself.  Thought it was cute and kinda fun to mix the syrup.

decor was really cute and comfortable. Quiet with jazz in the background.  We ordered jasmine black tea and taro tea and they were both delicious.  Would definitely bring someone back.  I recommend this place to chill and catch up.

This place is awesome! I walked in and was impressed with the place already. The cafe was clean and setup nicely. I was greeted with a warm welcome and was able to order the Earl Grey Loftti. It is was of the best tasting drinks I have tasted. They also have cotton candy as a topping! They have a rewards program that links to your phone number so you don't need to bring or remember a stamp card. Overall, this place is just great!

Decided to try out this place after reading some of the reviews. Cute place with really nice decor and atmosphere. 

I got the Sun Drop tea and my daughter got the Blush Peach. Both were okay...i wouldn't rush back to order these two drinks again. Average tasting, nothing special. Taste generic. The boba was a nice soft chewy texture but had absolutely no flavor at all.

Although it was a miss on the drinks we ordered, I will be back to try something different!

A very modern and adorable Korean cafe! It is a bit difficult to spot this place, so I suggest turning right into the opening directly after Robindale. Loftti Cafe is right next to the K Blossom Boutique. 

Earl Grey Frozen Cotton Candy: 5/5
The cost is $4.25 for about a 14 oz cup of shaved ice. The flavoring is delicious! It has a good balance of earl grey flavoring and sugar. It isn't too sweet nor are you overwhelmed by the taste of early grey. On top of the shaved ice and around the cup is cotton candy that looks like a cloud over it. 

Strawberry & Lychee Rain Drop Cake: 4/5
This trending cake is very unique at a low cost of $4.00. The "cake" is not actually a cake. It looks like a clear blob. I think this should be in your "Unique Foods To Try Bucket List" for sure because it is so weird. The gelatin part does not really have any flavor, but the fresh strawberry and lychee is what made the rain drop cake. On the plate with the cake, Loftti Cafe provides dipping sauces of chocolate and strawberry. I think if you're looking a "healthy" dessert, the rain drop cake is what you should order because from what I could tell it's just fruit, gelatin, and dipping sauce. 

The Price: 5/5
This is definitely one of the cheapest cafes I have been to. Most of the places I have been to their desserts average from $5-$7 while Loftti Cafe is around $4-$5 depending on what you get.

Finding this place can be challenging if you are not familiar with the area. It's at the very end of a strip mall with mostly Asian vendors and there is at least one other boba tea spot in the same block. 

Once you do find it, you will be glad that you did because it is clean and a really cute place. There are several options for drinks (teas, espresso/coffee, ice blended plus boba) and some interesting snack options like their raindrop dessert (gelatin based) and frozen cotton candy(flavored snow ice with cotton candy on top). 

I had a taro latti (ice blended version) with boba. It was delicious - sweeter than other versions - but that is how I like it. They are also pretty generous with the boba because normally I run out of boba halfway through my drink... but not this time! Their boba tasted fresh and had a soft chewy texture (I have been to places who undercook their boba). 

My son had the coffee frozen cotton candy and he really liked it. He says that the flavor was really good. 

This cafe is worth giving a try!
Great place, great drinks, great price! Very trendy and amazing staff! Just don't sit outside, the sewer interceptor line is too close and it's smelly.

I was here a few days ago and I don't have anything to completely rave about nor complain about. It was middle of the road cafe, and it has its uniqueness with its drinks and things. People were comfortable, studying, and hanging out.

I had a smoothie, and it was fresh ingredients, but a little to bland for my taste. And same goes for the lychee strawberry raindrop cake. While it looks pretty, it just reminded me of an expensive jelly candy cups that we used to eat as kids. It was cool to try it but I don't know that I'd order it again.

Again, nothing negative or particularly positive. I would probably go back.

Such a cute little cafe! close to my house I loved the decor and atmosphere. I don't really like the location, though. It's tucked in the back of Dairy Queen, so it's kind of dark at night. We were greeted as soon as we got in and was asked if it was our first time. The employees quickly introduced the menu to us which was very accommodating. 

I've only been here once, I was recommended by my cousin to order the Blush Peach signature iced tea since I love anything rose! It was pretty good, it wasn't too sweet for my liking. They serve the raindrop cake which is a big hype all over the internet right now that I would like to try next time I go! 

With all the new places opening up around this area, I haven't had the chance to come back. But I would definitely come back to try more and recommend anyone who is looking for some unique drinks with a great ambiance!

Didnt initially expect much out of raindrop cake. I knew the gelatin would be tasteless, but nevertheless, it was something new to try. They did a good job remodeling from the prior business that was there. Probably a good place for students to study.

Place can get busy usually students I guess studying, group studying. I love their peach blush haven't tried other drinks here yet. It's a nice place to hang out with friends it's kinda hidden. It's facing the side of Walgreens. It's a small place and parking is kinda hard when the whole complex is busy... prices are decent. Will definitely be back!

It's a hyped up Asian coffee shop! Their drinks are more aesthetic than tasty . They put a cotton candy on top of the cup, and honestly the drink its very sweet. Also their staff was not friendly at all, uncourteous girl at the register. I had a few questions about  drink menu and any  food and she looked at me like if I was asking for the Pythagoras theorem Which she probably knew but thought that  I was ignorant for not know it already jk .. anyway she didn't say anything pointed to a chalkboard menu when I asked if they had food. Only had bagel and a croissant . The croissant was pretty good

A great place with unique tastes of tea selections and desserts.
I had a 'Sun Drop' tea which was full of flavor. Def did my taste buds right. Also had the Raindrop Cake--- mild but sophisticated flavor; truly unique experience. 

The interior was trendy with a splash of antique touches here and there. Overall positive vibe of the place with def a great selection of music. Also tons of happy customers when I was there---really brightened the place up. 
Most of all---serious bang for buck! Great price and def worth every dime! Great spot for a break and/or date or just to hang out after school/work.

This cute modern place opened today
I was so lucky to be here on the first day

Love the interior 

I tried the honey black latti
Sooooooo good

Im happy this place open near my house

This is great stop after dinner

:)
Oasis in the desert. Good place to cool off for both visitors (i'm from Seattle) and locals(my gf). I love their fruit smoothies and matcha frozen cotton candy.

Grand open today

Loving this place already

Decor is so modern
Quite place relaxing place

BEST HOT MILK TEA I've had here in Vegas, so far. I got a regular sized honeydew milk tea with boba (hot.) With the winter weather change, it was the perfect drink. It was sweet and super creamy and their boba was AWESOME. It actually tasted great instead of bland rubber like most boba places I've been to in Vegas (besides Kung Fu, bc they're bomb af!) 

The lobby is super cute this time of year. They even have a Christmas tree! It's definitely a place you can study and work, but it does get pretty crowded towards the end of the night, especially on the weekends. They are open daily from 11:30AM to 11:30PM. 

I have yet to try the infamous raindrop dessert and their frozen cotton candy, but from all the craze I've heard, they are must try's for this establishment.

So good I'm back again the next day! I love love love cotton candy and was very pleased to see that they have a frozen cotton candy dessert! 
The atmosphere is similar to a Starbucks as you'll see people studying or doing work.

The location is a little difficult to find if you're on Rainbow. It's on the far right side of the plaza.

I got the Royal Thai latti since I was really craving Thai tea. I drink a lot of Thai tea and their version of Thai tea is far from authentic. I know you're probably thinking why I ordered Thai tea at a Korean cafe. I order Thai tea at places like Brew Tea Bar and theirs still taste really good. The Thai tea here just tasted like whole milk and sugar. You can hardly taste the Thai tea flavor , if anything it just tasted powdered. I also ordered mine at half sweet and it still tasted way too sweet .__." The boba was also overcooked and mushy. It should be more chewy or a bit on the firmer side.

Their earl grey frozen cotton candy is still pretty good though. Their frozen cotton candy is shaved ice with whatever flavor you choose & giant cotton candy on top. I don't really eat the cotton candy on top , but the earl grey mixed with shaved ice is my absolute favorite. Very soft and subtle flavor. 

The decorations here are very cute as well as the very friendly staff. I've been here quite a few times already and their drinks/boba are still just not my cup of tea.

Looooove it here the high ceiling, music just right, i have a thing for their chair, variety of natural light & dim lighting area, simple but hip! Their tea selections are lovely, perfect for summer. It'll get busy very soon for sure. 
Some feedbacks about the acoustics, maybe need some sofas or soft materials in the space to keep the echoes down. It gets annoying loud especially when the owner's friends come in and talk like nobody's business.

Late review, about a month late. Stopped here on the way to the airport. The places we usually go were closed and Loftti was open for about another 20 minutes. There was a party seated outside, inside a couple of other people. Decor is very cute, a little dark, or maybe because it was a late in the evening. It did make it feel cozy. Employee was preparing for closing but still helped us with a smile. We ordered an Iced Pistachio Latte and Taro Milk Tea w/Boba. Service was fast, our drinks were ready in about 5 minutes. Got in our car and made our way to the airport. OMG!!! I felt like I just swallowed a bag of sugar. Hoping it was just my drink, but nope, took a sip of my daughter's, and same thing. Maybe it was just a fluke, maybe I shouldn't have walked in right before closing, but either way, both drinks ended up in the trash. I will be back again though, the place is cute and I'd like to give it another try. It could've just been an off night for the employee
This is a nice place space is nice and not to loud but if you are a true coffee drinker this is not the place for you tea and frozen latti smoothie are what they do

After having our lunch, we walked across the parking lot and saw this place.. We ordered a coconut Latte frozen and a hot latte both with cotton candy.. Mine came with this very sweet and large cloud of cotton candy around the cup.. My husbands came with a sweet puff cloud of cotton candy on a spoon w/ his coffee. Both were unusual and very tasty and cute .. Loved the presentation..

Mami helped us with our order, very sweet and friendly. We ordered the Milk frozen cotton candy and the lychee strawberry raindrop dessert. The place is very nicely decorated and few people brought their laptop for work/studies. Light music in the background . 

Desserts were so pretty and delicious! I would come back just a place of peace and quiet from the strip !

First time here I'm from California. My cousins brought me here cause they have great customer service. And the raindrop cake of course. The best dessert I've had. Not heavy or too sweet. Highly recommend the the original flavor.

The place was quite empty and very calm. The cafe itself had a jazzy vibe to it. The employee in the front seemed shy and didnt ask if it was our first time and didnt explain the menu. I wish they had a separate menu you can hold and get a closer look instead of just looking at the wall (the font was small and kind of hard to read). 

My friend got the emerald iced tea and i got the sun drop iced tea. The teas were really flavorful and we were surprised! The drinks were also fairly cheap! Will most likely come back again (:

How cool is this!!
Cotton candy on your drink and raindrop desserts!!
I tried something out of my norm and it blew me away!! Better then a Starbucks any day

This place is out of the way and we used our transit pass to get here. I saw a picture of rain drop cakes on someone's Instagram, therefore, this was one of the places we decided to go before we set out to Vegas. Firstly it is nice to get off The Strip and go to some hipster coffee shops and stuff outside the tourist area for some variety and to make the most of the State. The inside is welcoming and down to earth. The menu was very overwhelming. We skipped most of the common desserts as dessert places like this are now a dime a dozen in Richmond, BC, however, one of the things that we haven't experienced at home enough is the rain drop cake which is a clear gelatin cake that looks like a rain drop. I know that the Richmond night market had one, however, it wasn't traditionally served with nuts and syrup. These guys served it the traditional way which surprised me. Funny that I would find something close to the real thing here than in Richmond of all places. I also had the Strawberry Lychee rain drop cake that I posted on Instagram. The customer service was friendly and the prices were very reasonable. Enough seating inside.

We tried this place because of the raindrop cake. That's the only food they have except for the frozen cotton candy (didn't try it). The drinks here are better than the raindrop cake. 
Raindrop cake: sugary flavorless jello with sesame powder & syrup
Drinks: Vanilla bean frozen latti- creamy, better than the one they have at Starbucks
Scarlet tea- refreshing tea, if you don't want an earthy tea then this is a great choice
Sundrop- this is the tea for people with a sweet tooth
Royal Thai- great Thai tea! Definitely a must! There was 4 of us and we ordered 2 more after tasting the first order 

Staff was friendly and the cafe itself had a great atmosphere. Good place to have tea and coffee with friends. I gave a 4 stars because of the drinks
Tastes really good! I ordered Earl Grey cotton candy and lychee rain drop cake. You should go(:

Loftti Cafe has become one of my favorite cafes for unique dessert and inexpensive tea. If you've seen people post about raindrop cakes and cotton candy on top of an icy dessert, this is where you'll find them!

Raindrop Cake - 2/5 // When Loftti first opened, the first thing I wanted to try was the famous raindrop cake. The flavor is extremely light (practically flavorless to me, imo) so it is necessary to have something paired with it. At the time it was paired with a red bean sauce and soy flour, but it was still nothing extravagant to me. The experience was awesome for another photo of a unique dish, but it wouldn't be something that I would recommend for my friends to try.

Matcha Frozen Cotton Candy - 5/5 // I've seen a bunch of photos of this cotton candy mystery and I honestly didn't know what it was until I finally ordered it. The lady at the cashier described it as shaved ice with cotton candy on top, but honestly the texture of the dessert was more like shaved snow. I was actually expecting shaved ice, but I was pleasantly surprised that its texture was more like shaved snow for a light and fluffy body.

I've gone to a lot of coffee/tea places in Las Vegas and by far this is the place with the cheapest loose leaf hot tea. ($2 for a small!) There are plenty of seats if you need to work on something productive or just hang out with your friends.

They have a loyalty star system that collects your number to keep track of your purchases. After 10 stars, you can get a free drink or shaved ice!

Loftti is such a cute and modern cafe here in Vegas. Since I live close by I'm a frequent customer here. 
This place is great for students to study or to catch up with old friends. 
I usually get their frozen cotton candy. I recommend trying their lavender or earl grey flavor. 
As for their raindrop cake, I would pick either the green tea or strawberry and lychee. I don't recommend the original or regular unless you like your desserts to be plain and not sweet.
I have mix feelings about this place, because sometimes I get beyond awesome services and sometimes I so-so service. 
I can't wait to try the rest of their men!

This cafe is absolutely adorable. The atmosphere is very comforting and relaxing! Nice decorations, plenty of seating, and great music. Being Korean, with a Korean server, the customer service was perfect! She was able to communicate with my parents in Korean while speaking in English with me. Also, she was super cute and friendly! 

I got an iced tea that was a blend of peach and hibiscus. I believe it had a third flavor but I can't recall what it was. It was super good and refreshing! They had a great selection to choose from as well, so I'm excited to go back and try some more 

I also got the frozen cotton candy. It's basically very thin, shaved ice with whatever flavor you choose. I got matcha and it tasted great! Soft and subtle with yummy matcha cream (I think) underneath the "cotton candy" on top. 

LASTLY, MY FAVORITE PART! This cafe has raindrop cake. For those of you that don't know, it's a dessert that was developed in Japan I believe. It's a small "cake" that resembles a raindrop! Super cool. It comes with power and a red bean paste which gave it a wonderfully sweet combination overall. After having seen several videos of the dessert in Japan, I was excited to see it available here! It was GREAT 

Thank you Cafe Loftti! I will see you again soon!

Went for the raindrop cake. Definitely cool looking. As for taste, its like jello with fruit bits. Nothing too unique but definitely picture worthy. 

Cute little spot. Friendly service and very welcoming!

May was extremely pleasant and friendly! She was very knowledgable of the menu and explained everything to me very clearly. I tried the white coconut latti with boba, and it was so creamy and delicious!!!
I also tried my friend's Scarlett iced tea. It was not my favourite thing, but it did have a very powerful taste to it.
Next time, I will definitely be trying out the famous raindrop cake! Can't wait to come back!

Stopped by the place after dinner just about 10mins before they closed. Normally the server or cashier would give you some attitude for coming in late, but the cashier here stayed very polite and took the order. 
Got a taro milk tea with boba and cotton candy. It's soooo good! The cotton candy is definitely not something you see all the time.

What can I say? There TARO bubble tea is the BEST I've ever had ...I keep getting it when I'm in the area ...I won't even allow myself to try something else bc the TARO bubble tea is JUST that DARN good!

I heard about Loftti from a friend because a friend recommended that I try the raindrop dessert. It's located in the same plaza as Goong kbbq, and the outside is so adorable. It welcomed customers with a cute welcome sign and a big smile from the cashier up front. She took us through the menu, which was surprisingly very affordable! More affordable than some of the boba places out here. 

I ended up having the green tea raindrop dessert and the strawberry lychee raindrop. Green tea is da best tho :)

Overall, atmosphere was cute, menu affordable, and super yummy! :)

This place is so awesome! The food and drinks are cool, but it's also the environment that Tiffany makes that's super cool. The lighting and music are calming. The decorations are amazing, especially during Halloween or Christmas, Tiffany tries her best to make the cafe look presentable. Plus, she's super nice and so are all the other people who work there. Thank you, Loftti Cafe!

Cute Korean cafe with a variety of unique drinks styled with cotton candy. The perfect place to get your work done and hang out with your friends.

Highly recommend drinks from the Tea section since they are beautiful and delicious ! Prices are fair and you're getting what you pay for. 

It would be great if there's more option on milk for those who are lactose. Overall, it's a great place!
Giving 4 starts for their decor,  friendly staff but desserts and tea didn't make 5 star

I've been coming here to study for the past few days with my friends because it's such a nice environment! There are outlets for charging computers and free wifi. The seating area is a little small and I've seen people have to leave after getting their drinks because there wasn't any space left. It's surprising to see many customers stay for long periods of time because they're so absorbed in their "work." I guess the environment is quite motivating! The drinks are also super affordable and different from other drink places. I've been seeing a lot of people get the clouds and frozen cotton candy, it looks amazing and I want to try it some time! I've been trying new drinks but so far my favorite is the Scarlet Iced Tea, I definitely recommend it for someone who enjoys sweet hibiscus teas. Since this place is so close to home, I know I'll be coming in often for drinks and staying to work on homework or study!

We got the matcha latti and pomegranate oolong tea.

The matcha latti has a good strong matcha flavor, but the pomegranate oolong is very weakly brewed. 

The cashier lady is very friendly and nice. Very relaxed vibe, love the decor.

Came in with my mom and my little sis. First of all, atmosphere of this place is so nice with jazz music on background. Employee was very friendly.
We all got drinks with boba. I was really happy that there was a selection of real fruit smoothie and they taste great! Sweetness was just right and boba was squishy which is totally awesome. I know i will come back because i know i want to try their milk tea.
It's a pretty chill place to study. Also THEIR FROZEN EARL GREY TEA IS SO GOOD. As in it's so creamy and yummy and amazing! I hate sharing it with friends!

What a fun tea shop! They have some really fun options that really set it apart from other tea places. Frozen cotton candy! It's a shaved ice dessert with a twist (cotton candy on top). They also have latti, a milk based beverage that comes in all sorts of flavors and a frozen option for hot days. I highly suggest you try the frozen taro latti. It's purple, lightly sweet and absolutely delicious. So refreshing on a warm day. They also have a variety of delicious iced teas, fruity teas and classic teas in both hot and cold options. There's so many things to try and everything tastes great. You can't help but come back to try something new. So far everything I've tried is my favorite thing in the menu.

I like their unique coffee, tea, and raindrop desserts. Coming here is kind of like a boutique experience, I don't do it for the coffee so much as the uniqueness of it all. 

I've gotten their lavender latte and both the green tea and the strawberry rain drop cake flavors. The flavors of coffee they have are different, not bad or great, just unique. But in Las Vegas to be honest it doesn't really stand out, it's just more unique than Starbucks.

No drive through. Very limited parking (like 2 spots).

The inside is cramped and smelled like sewage in most of the seating area, it's right next to the bathroom door.

Cute little boba shop in Spring Valley with hipster interior decor from succulents to wood themed tables. The honey milk black tea was excellent. The boba balls were much firmer than I was used to. I didn't get to try their main attraction, the raindrop cake, but maybe I'll come back for it another day. It is quite dark inside because Loftti is hidden behind the plaza away from the sunlight, so I wouldn't recommend it for studying. It is a great spot to chill and hang out with friends over boba. If you stay for some time, fart- like smells will pop in and out to say hello. I'm not sure if it was something that they were cooking in the back or gases that were released from the people around me, but it wasn't a pleasant smell. I stayed for about two hours until I couldn't stand it anymore and left.
Newest place on rainbow and robindale. I love their deco and music. But for most i love their tea and milk tea.

I can't possibly be the only one who thought of American Horror Story when seeing the Loftti Cafe sign above the door for the very first time! Or maybe I am. Anyways, I've had this cafe bookmarked for quite some time now and I finally found the perfect opportunity to visit!

My friend and I had just eaten lunch at Lake Las Vegas and were in the mood for boba, so we decided to drive all the way to this side of town for a drink! Because let's face it, we all know there's no decent boba spots in Henderson.

Loftti Cafe is a bit hard to find if you're not familiar with the area. It's hidden in the very corner of a strip mall. Upon entering Loftti, we were greeted by a very soft spoken, yet super friendly employee. She could tell that it was our first time by the way we looked at the menu, so she offered to explain their options to us. 

Of course we ordered everything but the boba that we originally came for! We ordered two of the Frozen Cotton Candy desserts with the coffee flavor and one original Raindrop Cake. The Frozen Cotton Candy was actually really good. I loved the ice part of the dessert. It tastes just like Häagen-Dazs coffee ice cream, but a smooth shaved ice texture. The cotton candy was a nice touch and added the perfect amount of sweetness, but I would definitely eat the shaved ice by itself! It was rich and creamy... Something I would definitely order again! The Raindrop Cake however, that's a different story! Two words- Weird AF! Or is that technically three? I had to try it after seeing it being circulated on my Facebook timeline a million times. It was definitely unique and worth trying, but it's not something that I would have to eat again. The concept is almost like that of Jell-O, but without the flavor. The soy flour and sugar syrup topping was definitely needed!

Overall, a really cute cafe to catch up with a friend or get some studying done! I loved the decorations on the shelves in the back... It reminded me of a bunch of random things you'd find in an old attic! I'll definitely be back soon to try this White Coconut Latti that everyone speaks so highly of!

If you like milk teas try the jasmine green "latti" which is a jasmine green milk tea , and add boba and lychee jelly! So yummy!! The inside is decorated really cute and has a rustic modern look. Also the workers are very helpful and nice. If i lived in vegas i would definitely be back often.

The place is clean, calm, and relaxing. It's a great place to study. The beverage options are flexible. I enjoyed having boba balls with my tea. The staff was very kind and helpful with recommending products based on my mood/craving.
OK I LOVE THIS PLACE!! The workers are so so nice and the cafe is just so cute! The raindrop cake is amazing and only $3.25!!! 10/10 recommend!!
Customer service is so nice! And pretty good teas and smoothies too! Rain drop cakes are cool too!

Definitely one of my new favorite cafes to sit and catch up with friends or get some good studying done! The music is very calming and the volume is just right! The way this place is decorated is very simple, modern, and cute. The employees there are really nice and very welcoming when you enter. My favorite drink here as of this moment would be the blush peach! The pricing of this place is also a plus in my opinion!

Raindrop Cake (a.k.a. Mizu Shingen Mochi) is available in Vegas!? Thanks,Yelp. I'm so exited!

This cute café is so cozy with relaxing piano music in the background. I came here in the morning, but this is a perfect place to have a cup of tea after dinner. Love the wall decorations.
I never had real Rain Drop Cake in Japan but I tried to make it myself about two years ago when I saw a recipe on YouTube. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pCQUMAD-Jao) Nope, I couldn't make it as good as the picture so I forgot about it until I recently saw it on Yelp. 
The Rain Drop Cake is perfect for someone who's watching calories. I don't think it has any calories (if anything 15 or so) but sweet and refreshing. Perfect for summer. Kinako soy bean powder and green tea syrup matched perfect with the Rain Drop Cake. Some may say it's just a tasteless, colorless Jell-O, but I do not think so. It's better. I can't wait to have Original (Kuromitsu black sugar syrup) version!!
I also had their Jasmine tea (unsweetened). Freshly brewed and delicious.
The girl (I think she's Korean) was so nice and friendly. I can tell she's the kind of a person that can still put a nice smile on her face even if she was having a bad day. Thumbs up for her :-)
Across the street from Walgreen's. (Same shopping center as Dairy queen) Outside seating available. Easy parking.

One of my favorite study spots. Although it is quite far from my house their black tea and salted caramel frappes are amazing. They also have a very unique dessert known as the raindrop (I think that's the name), and it's a must try. It's basically a gelatin in the form of a raindrop and you get to choose what flavor you want on the side to give your raindrop flavor as it is flavorless alone. I chose to go with the green tea and was not disappointed. I couldn't remember all the flavors but I think there was strawberry flavor as well. Only downside is that I wish the staff didn't put you on a time clock when entering as you will need to order something Incase it gets busy plus it's common courtesy to buy something as they are letting us occupy space. As for the food itself, It's nothing special and overpriced.

OMG... I love this place! It's very unique and cozy. Their drinks are delicious and their cups are so cool. Must try a raindrop cake.. I hope that's how you call it :) Also had a matcha cotton candy and that was great! The girl that helped me was very sweet. My favorite coffee place!

I'm so glad I live like 5 min away from this place because their drinks are amazing.

My favorite drink is their Royal Thai. It is similar to Thai tea except it is much more creamy and richer. I also like their taro latti because it is not too powdery like at other places. My friends tried their honeydew latti and also really liked it. 

I also tried their famous rain drop dessert but this was a miss to me. The drop itself is gelatin like and doesn't really have flavor. If you mix it all up then it mostly taste like sesame to me in my opinion, besides that, there's no sweetness or really any other flavor. The presentation of the dessert itself is really nice but I would not get it again. 

Their cotton candy cloud desserts are just basically snow fluff with cotton candy around it, which can get messy to eat.

Service is very nice and quick. They also have a reward system that does not require a stamp card. You just insert your phone number and that's where all your rewards will be collected, which is very convenient for people who tend to forget or lose their stamp cards.

Even though their desserts are a miss to me, I love their drinks and will always come back for them.

I'm not a big fan of cafes in general but this place is special. Not only does Loftti Cafe have a variety of unique menu items, I really dig the atmosphere. It doesn't try to hard to follow a basic trend and really develops its own voice. The attention to detail in the interior is immediately noticable-The big, dark wooden table with the pull-out chairs, the bookshelf full of antique books and wacky figurines and the magazine rack that spans nearly to the ceiling.

The blush peach is heralded and rightfully so. I am a big fan of the blush peach tea as it taste sweet but not over the top. I don't have a big sweet-tooth and the blush tea being pretty moderate is like a match made in heaven for me.

The cotton candy slushii/shaved snow is really cool. Not only is it Instagrammable af it's quite tasty too :D I haven't had cotton candy in ages so it was pretty nostalgic for me. On the bottom is a slushii treat that is amazing in its icy, refreshing goodness.

Overall my experience was very positive and I'm a big fan of Loftti's atmosphere, presentation and refreshments.

MY NEW SPOT!!! I love everything I ordered! The service is awesome!!!!!! Everyone is so friendly and always smiling!!! I literally went here twice within a week. I live about 35-40 mins to this place but its sooo worth it!!! 

1st Visit:
Raindrop Cake
Honey Black Tea
Emerald 

2nd Visit:
Frozen Cotton Candy
Blush Peach
Summer Breeze

EVERYTHING IS WORTH TRYING!!!

Another café has opened and their Japanese raindrop cakes are only what sets them apart from other establishments. 

I was super stoked to try their raindrop cake so I tried it with green tea sauce. Unfortunately for me, the new employees dumped too much kinako (soybean flour) so when I took a bite, I choked and my throat stayed itchy. 
Other than that, it's just about calorie-free so I didn't expect much in taste. It was nutty from the flour though. Would I order it again? Maybe if a friend really wanted it and asked to share.

I came back another time to study with friends and decided to order a royal Thai latti (a Thai tea slush) with boba. To be honest, I was disappointed because it was made from powder and there wasn't much boba either. The amount of money I spent on that drink could have went to a drink from Brew Tea Bar. 
Aside from the negative Nancy complaints, the service was good and no doubt the ambience was fairly comfortable. The employees consistently checked up on us and cleaned up our tables quickly when we finished our raindrop cakes. The decor was radically unique as well. 

Let's say if I ever do come back to study, I'll probably just order an iced tea.

Sorry Loffti. It's not you, it's me :-(
Drinks and service have been consistent every time I've went. Location is well decorated and maintained! Highly recommend Honey Black with Boba

First off, this cafe does have two things that set it apart from others. That would be the Raindrop Dessert/Cake and the Frozen Cotton Candy.

The Raindrop Cake reminds me of the lychee jelly cups you can get from most Asian supermarkets. My mom used to buy them for me and my siblings when we were kids. They taste very similar and both have the same exact texture. These Raindrop Cakes are no different and are just a bigger version of them.. served on a plate. If it wasn't for the strawberries and lychee in the one that we ordered, we would have just been eating a glob of flavorless gelatin. Definitely not the dessert to make a drive for.

Their Frozen Cotton Candy is another treat that I thought was pretty original. Plus, it's the first that I know of in Vegas. It's not overwhelmingly sweet, and the small cup that it comes in makes the portion just right. Some of the flavors you can choose for this dessert are Milk, Matcha, Coffee, and Earl Grey.

Now for the unpleasant part of our visit.. I'm a pretty patient person when it comes to customer service and I like to give businesses a second chance to redeem themselves, even if my first impression was not a good one. So with that being said... Here's our experience.

Around the time that my siblings and I arrived, which was shortly after 11:30 PM, there was one girl working behind the counter. She came to greet us as soon as we walked in, but already seemed to be irritated. She didn't ask us any questions and just stood there. No biggie. While looking at the menu, my bro asked me about their Matcha and what I would recommend, since I've tried this place before. Right when I was going to say something back, this girl had to blurt out what Matcha was, like we didn't know, and gave us a look of irritation. Umm.. Ok? Strike two. Before answering my bro, I thought I'd ask about the frozen cotton candy's Milk flavor. There was no description for it on the menu, so I asked if it was a "Milk Tea". The girl didn't answer my question and tried to educate me on something else. I asked again, but she started talking about other menu items they offer. So my sis jumped in and asked to clarify the flavor. Again, girl tries to inform us about something else, but in the middle of our question! Why do you have to talk over our voice? How do you know what we're asking if you're not listening? Sis asked again, but in a different tone, and finally we got an actual answer. For a second there, it looked like an argument was about to go down! She gave us a lil attitude so my sis gave it back. She needed a taste of her own medicine. Right before we left, she came by to ask us what we thought. Ignoring what had happened earlier, we complimented on the uniqueness of the desserts. Her demeanor did a 360 because she acted way different from before. Guess she got the memo.
 
So, in short, I won't be coming back for awhile. As much as I enjoyed the frozen cotton candy, it will just have to wait until next time.

Another hot day in Vegas so I decided to stop by. Very straight-forward menu teas,teas. LOVE!!! I tried the Royal Thai tea and I must say one of the best thai teas that I've had hands down. Very creamy sweet but not overly sweet  fair price. Will definitely be back to try the other drink options this Vegas summer!!

With all the Boba and Tea places opening up on S Rainbow I was hoping Loffti would standout from the crowd.  Sadly it is nothing special.  The daughter had the Honeydew Latti which was ok.  I had the Golden Medalist real fruit smoothie and the wife got the Mango smoothie.  The Golden Medalist has strawberry and banana.  The smoothie were on the small side despite being a large.  Their competitors have a much better value.
   The bananas in my smoothie were not ripe which gave the smoothie a bad taste.  The Mango smoothie was ok.  The service is good and the interior is really nice.  That being said Brew Tea is much better.  It is a shame they don't have more coffee as they need something to stand out from the many  beverage places just a few blocks from them.  Well I gave them a try.

Very cute place! The strawberry lychee raindrop cake is a must. It was good. Had to order a second one. This place is kid friendly. The 2 girls that worked there were very nice. They serve cotton candy. My kids loved it. Will be coming back.

Super cute place with unique and yummy desserts. We had the raindrop dessert with matcha syrup and powder. Oh my goodness.... what was that deliciousness... we also had the frozen cotton candy with matcha shaved ice. It's exactly that. Enjoyed every bite.

The only thing I get here so far is their hot chocolate but I definitely will try their bobas and teas! 
Their hot chocolate is the best compared to Starbucks or any other coffee shop. It just doesn't taste like there is any of that extra stuff that other places put in.

I just wish that they're open before 11:30am! I would LOVE to come in around 9:30am before I go to school in the winter time to get the hot chocolate hahaha

I am IN LOVE with this coffee shop! It's in a little bit of an odd spot -- in the corner of cross streets but somewhat hidden behind Dairy Queen. Definitely a hidden gem! I come for the tea. Their tea lattis are amazing! And their boba is also fabulous. I discovered this place a couple weeks ago and already almost done with my stamp card. Oh yeah, they have a stamp card! I love rewards. All the workers are very friendly and helpful. I love the ambiance -- very modern, clean, quiet, with very mellow yet classic music. Would definitely recommend.

I only came here once, and so I'm rating this on the Earl Grey Latte that I got. After asking quite a few questions about the drinks to the nice girl at the register, she explained a lot of different things about the drinks that used dairy milk vs the ones that used non-dairy creamer, which was good to know.

I ended up with the Earl Grey latte and it was SO GOOD. This location is a little far, and in a weird little plaza, and in a weird side location facing the street. Not sure how often I'll be coming out here, but I definitely enjoyed this drink and would like to try the desserts one day.

I was so excited to try this place, but I left this established unsatisfied.  For the drinks I got the red velvet latti and blush peach ice tea. The tea was good, but the red velvet latti didn't have any flavor to it. It tasted like ice water blended into a frappe with red food coloring added. My boyfriend mentioned it tasted just like a protein shake. I'm giving this place a two star because of the interior and friendliness of the worker. It's definitely a cool place to hang out with friends or study. The biggest turn off for me was their bathroom. I know it sounds crazy to judge a place due to their bathrooms, but I've never seen anything like this before. I tried going to the ladies room, but the toilet was clogged and the floor had so many spills. Then I tried going to the men's bathroom which was even worse! This is disappointing considering its location and how clean everything else is.

This is now my favorite cafe. It's atmosphere is very "industrial". The best part of this cafe is it plays jazz, blues, and classical music. It's the best music to listen to when i'm studying or just want to do research for fun. On top of that, the dim lights create a relaxing mood. It's a very small cute cafe. I've been through a lot of cafes in Vegas but this definitely became my favorite one. 

The service is really fast and the girls were sweet! There was a confusion with my order but they took care of it right away to satisfy me. Haha. 

The raindrop dessert was definitely a new thing. If you're filipino and you've tried Chocnut candy, it tastes exactly like that lol.
The staffs were so friendly and we all loved their taro smoothie and Earl Grey/coffee latti cotton candy drink!  Yummy!!  Also, the place is very clean, and the setting and ambiance was great.

Really really cute lil cafe with modern decor. Nice place to hang out with friends. Tried the RAINDROP dessert and it was good just nothing spectacular. What my lil one did love was her boba tea with cotton candy on top! Mango slush also had great mango flavor and sweetness was just right. Being a BOBA connoisseur, I would say their boba is pretty good, almost perfect. We would come back again if we wanted to get boba and hang out and chit chat. Love the late hours.

Love the atmosphere and their prices are incredibly reasonable! Most cafés I got to price their drinks closer to $5, but I got their lychee ginger tea with lychee jelly for less than $3. Though their smoothies are closer to $5, they use real fruits. The staff is also really nice and helpful. The girl at the front asked me if it was my first time and gave me a full explanation of their menu. Another nice thing about this place is there's a lot of space and they actually have a big table (which I struggle with finding at other places) Awesome first impression and experience (:

I ordered Taro Milk Green Tea because we're supposed to get boba at Kung Fu Tea but my co worker's GPS missed it and ended at Loftti, but she still ordered what I want (even though it's not on their menu haha). Well it came out the way how I want it, but it's more better. so I totally give 5 stars to this place. Service is good, the employees greets you as soon as you walked in. And a Nice little spot to study or to chill with friends. There's some nice Kpop music playing too. I'll definitely be back and try their different drinks

Although Loffti café isn't the first of its kind, it's definitely among one of the best cafés because of its wonderful service and atmosphere. The music and decorations of the place is suits its "loffi" theme, giving me a sense of home and comfort. Its frozen cotton candy stood out from other brands of shaved ice because of its softer texture. Despite the limited flavors for their frozen cotton candy, the unique earl grey was more than enough to satisfy my cravings along with the jasmine green Latte. The boba could be a bit sweeter, but the drink had the perfect amount of sweetness. Loffti café is the first place I've been to to offer raindrop cake. It's definitely something worth trying and it's great that this place has offers certain items and flavors usually not found anywhere else. I'll be back soon.
Such a cute place and staff is very friendly. The jasmine green tea latti is my favorite!

Loftti is so interesting and definitely new to this part of town! I ordered the Thai milk tea with boba and the infamous raindrop cake. The Thai milk tea with boba was okay, I consider it an acquired taste. The matcha raindrop cake was amazing tho! I know it takes a long time to make it and you could tell each raindrop cake is made to perfection. The cake itself has no flavor but when you coincide it with the matcha, it is fantastic! It is a very weird concept but I absolutely love it!

The atmosphere is very minimalist, the prices are extremely reasonable, the staff is sweet as all get out, and the food is superb! 
The only thing I would even mention as bothersome is the lighting. It's a bit dark in the cafe at night. Oh, parking is usually full too.

This place is pretty awesome! I highly recommend their earl grey latti which is like a milk tea. Drinks are not overly sweet and it is a nice place to study! It is a little far from me, but nice place to stop by during my lunch work break. Great point system as well. Just put in your number and you don't need to carry around a stamp card. :)

I really love this place for their iced teas, specifically the Sundrop because it's a hibiscus flower base, and I honestly love it. I believe it's the perfect about of sweetness, the place is very cozy and really cute, and the staff is super friendly! They greet you everytime you walk in, and the drinks are reasonably priced. I think I've came here probably four times in one day once and I come atleast once a week! I really love this place! I also tried the raindrop cake for fun, it's pretty but the taste is plain. I wasn't expecting much since I already knew what it was made with! They serve it as a desert
 in Japan! C:

A great place! It's a little hidden but it's a very cute cafe. I have only had the teas but I have not had one that I didn't enjoyed. The workers are always really nice and welcoming. I've never had to wait more than five minutes for a drink. It does get a little crowded inside sometimes but it's just as good if you take it to go!

Big fan of the location of this place. Love that I can get to and from Loftti without having to deal w/ the clusterf*** of Rainbow Blvd and enjoy the lined palm trees down Windmill. South of Rainbow enough to not feel so congested. 

I have gotten the honey black, matcha, and thai iced tea lofttis with boba which I enjoyed thoroughly. A little bit pricier than Brew Tea bar but hits the spot. Staff has always been friendly and décor is super cute. Definitely the kind of spot I'd go "study" at if I had anything to study. Boba is nice and soft, I'd ask them to go light on the ice or get blended so that the ice will melt before you finish the entire drink. I have a history of gulping it all down before I leave the parking lot and get angry at the ice for not melting fast enough so consider this my good deed of the day.

I was hoping to really like this place.  I didn't. Cool concept, the raindrop cake has a nice milk flavor but it's nothing I would come back for.

My kids shared the frozen cotton candy which is basically shaved ice with cotton candy on top.  Glad to have this place crossed off my list but probably won't be returning any time soon.

Parking is a little complicated.  If there's no spots on the side, you kind of have to park around the corner.

My girlfriend and I always try to look for good cafes around town. We actually live around the Aliante area, but we wanted to try this place because of all the good reviews, great atmosphere, and unique menu. Though it took us more than 30 minutes to get there, Loftti was worth the long drive. 

The atmosphere is one of the most important aspects when it comes to cafes. Loftti has its own color that we have not seen in Vegas so far. Furnitures, wall arts, and little decorations all come together to creat Loftti's own rustic, yet modern atmosphere. We stayed there for a while because it was just so comfortable. 

We tried the original Raindrop dessert, Matcha Frozen Cotton Candy, and Blush Peach tea. All of them are unique to Loftti. The cotton candy and the peach tea were on point! We actually bought two more of them on the way out because we liked them so much. The Raindrop dessert was interesting, but not as good as the other two items. I'm sure kids will love them though!

Loftti will be the go-to-spot for us whenever we go the Southwest area!

Best place to grab variety smoothies and other refreshing drinks! You should definitely try there frozen cotton candy (especially earl grey flavor).  All the staffs are nice and you feel very welcome.

really nice decoration its feels like different kind of coffee shop other than other places.
My first time here today and I will be back for sure!

If I'm craving a refreshing drink with lychee jelly, this place is my go to. My favorite is the White Coconut Latti with lychee jelly. It's cute inside, a quaint little cafe. I've seen people study and just hang out there. I often go with my boyfriend for a quick date. My large family will come in every once in a while around 10pm and just chill there talking. It's nice. For dessert the raindrop cakes taste good! Love the original flavor, it's like a clear little jello.

Went here August 17,2016 two ladies working at night. Upon entry we were greeted and we were asked if we've been there before. She explained the menu and answered any questions we had. Another lady came out and explained the teas and suggested the jasmine green tea latti. My partner ordered the coffee frozen cotton candy and my son ordered the matcha flavor. 

The jasmine green tea latti was soo amazing !! I've been looking for this type of tea for a long time. If you don't like the jasmine taste I don't think you'll like it. I loved it soo much ! 

The frozen cotton candy coffee and matcha was very good, it had a milky but frozen texture. Very satisfying. 

We also tried the original and green tea rain drop. It was refreshing the cake part had no taste but the sauce on the side made it good. Be careful with the powder ! 

My brother was impressed with the Americano and my sister in law liked her taro boba, she said the Boba was fresh and soft. I didn't get to try cause they tore it up. 

Also one of the ladies made us a sample of the coconut freeze I forgot what it was called but that was something with coconut and it was good! 

I wish we got the ladies names cause they were very friendly and accommodating! 

We will be coming back, Thanks for the excellant experience !

Social media has lead me to try this place out. After having bookmarked it awhile, I finally got the chance to check it out. Overall ambience of the café was very rustic, quirky with a modern twist. The staff could improved, because I felt like I was being treated as if I was uneducated. I didn't get her name but she could use a lesson in, "Humility." The few items we got were ok. The raindrop cake was flavorless. It was like Jello from the hospital but the presentation was cool and IG worthy. The Frozen Cotton Candy was good. It was probably something I would come back for. The light sweet taste of cotton candy mixed with the frozen coffee mixture was delicious. Not too sweet and bitter but balanced.

Overall not a bad place to gather with friends or have a study session. I wasn't able to try any of their drinks but if Im ever in the area, I might give them a second chance.

2017 Yelp Review #17
This cafe is very modern and cute. I had the vanilla bean frozen latti and it tasted amazing! Great customer service. I'll definitely be coming here often.

This place is certainly unique and different. They have many selections of their teas, latti, and smoothies. I've tried a few drinks from them before and this time I ordered an iced Jasmine Green Latti and it's perfect if you love tea! I also love the shop's ambiance; the decorations and set up looks amazing and also feels cozy. This would make a great spot for studying, doing homework or even catching up with a friend. Customer service here is also excellent; the girls that work here are friendly and gave me recommendations on what to try this time. I'll definitely be back and want to try other items on the menu.

Loftti is a great spot to grab some boba tea, lattes, or dessert! It's hard to stand out in this part of town if you are a cafe - boba tea places are everywhere! Loftti makes a name for itself with original iced tea blends, their tea lattes (great if you're looking to avoid caffeine!!!) and their shaved ice desserts topped with cotton candy (SO instagrammable)! The decor and aesthetic inside is cohesive and trendy. The baristas (barisTEAs?) are always friendly and answered any and all questions we had. My vegan husband actually forgot to order his drink with almond milk once and the barista actually remade his drink for him! (We would never normally expect someone to do this, but it was SO thoughtful; we were seriously impressed.) 

Our family comes here all the time as a treat, and it's a great place to bring out of town guests or anyone you'd like to show something new or a little bit different.

Cutest little place! When you turn in on Rainbow, make sure you turn right and it'll be across from Walgreens.

They've got some adorable desserts and drinks. The manager was very knowledgeable and they have a lot of flavors available!

Everyone seems to be talking about Lofti cafe and their raindrop cake so I decided to join the bandwagon and try it. Yes, it will make for a cute Instagram pic but it's nothing to go apeshit over. 

Establishment is nicely done. It has a nice warm and cozy feeling with some great jazz music in the background. Big table in the middle is perfect for studying with outlet plugs dangling down from the ceiling which can charge up to 6 laptops. I really dig the classy + hip vibe here.

Servers were friendly and greeted us with "we've been waiting for you" to set the casual tone. After some interactions, we ordered their original raindrop cake and jasmine latti with boba. 

Raindrop cake itself doesn't have any flavor. You have to mix the syrup and powder that comes with it. I had expected that their raindrop cake would be similar to mochi and have that sticky texture. Instead, it was jello-like and very soothing, almost as if there is some kind of herbs inside. Very delicate and light dessert which is perfect to cool off in the hot Vegas heat. 

Would I go back for it? Maybe, but considering it's something that can be easily made at home, I'm not crazy over it. 

Upon ordering my drink, a server had told me how they take pride in their drinks. "Unlike all the other boba shops in Vegas that uses all artificial syrups/powders with old/stale boba, we use freshly brewed teas and make fresh boba every day." I was surprised to hear this because I can name at least 5 boba shops in Vegas that brews teas/make fresh boba. 

My jasmine latti (jasmine milk tea) was one of the worst rendition I have had. It had an unpleasant herbally/minty taste which I am most decidedly not a fan of. Boba was a glob of disappointment. I am 120% sure that it wasn't fresh. Wasn't warm and not cooked all the way. In fact, it was very similar to one of those "cook at home" boba you can get at any Asian supermarket. I was a little disappointed with my drink overall.

At the end, the same server informed us that we can get one free 16oz drink by writing a Yelp review. I'm not really fond of that idea of luring people to write a review for free things...perhaps I have ordered the wrong items but I won't go out of my way for this cafe.

Simple cafe tucked in shopping center.

Girls at front really nice & soft spoken.
I ordered the famous raindrop cake.
The gelatin cake was a little sweet with some strawberries with a little tang. The dipping sauces enhanced the flavor.

I had the honeydew milk tea that was sweet and delush. Usual pricing around this part of town. Parking a little tight since there are several businees in compact shopping center.

Nicely decorated inside with bench seating.

Their drinks are good but not my favorite. It's a great place to study or chill and have boba or something. The store itself is really comfy and there's a couch! 

I've tried matcha, taro, honey black, etc. which I recommend.

I was craving a matcha tea latte, found this cute place on rainbow and robindale. Its kind of on the side but it's a bright light sign so you can't miss it!  The decor is beautiful inside. Its chill and quiet. There's a huge table w outlet space so a great study place. They have the raindrop dessert so I'll have to come back and try it. My latte was well worth the drive! For a first time stop, it's a great impression!

I came here one night with a friend to try the much talk about raindrop cake. It is a gelatin dessert served with a sweet brown sugar and roasted sesame powder. The dessert is not very sweet and is quite refreshing actually. Fyi the raindrop cake looks bigger in pictures, so don't be too disappointed when you see the actual size of the dessert.  Another fun dessert to try are the frozen cotton candy.  Pick you shaved ice flavor (milk, coffee, matcha, earl grey, lavender, etc.), then it is top off with sweet cotton candy, too cute to eat!

To me a five star establishment surpasses all levels of service. 

This place's ambiance and decor is relaxing yet has lots of character. It's dim but well lit enough to do some studying or any kind of work (which you'll see many people do here). Lots of little statues and books that give it character. 

The actual product is great. I ordered an iced golden lychee tea and a ham and cheese croissant. Both had lots of flavor and I thoroughly enjoyed it along with the ambiance.

The service is fantastic. A friendly hello as soon as you walk in, everyone looks relaxed and happy, and for the most part they leave you alone to enjoy your coffee/tea unless you need something. I received my tea in a few minutes after ordering and croissant about 10 minutes after ordering. 

The price is very reasonable. For my tea and croissant sandwich, I paid about $9. I love that some places keep their product high with reasonable pricing. 

Little add on- The place is extremely clean including the restrooms and there are tons of options from coffee to tea to desserts to smoothies to specialty drinks and some sandwiches. Will definitely come back and look forward to trying more things!
was good / the latti was a little strangely sweet, but still yummy. Looking forward to trying other items. the staff is wonderful and very knowledgeable about the items

The jiggly raindrop desert finally hit Vegas!

Since this was the main reason we came to Loftti, it was already a given that we were going to order that. However, with much help from the 2 nice girls behind the counter, we were able to choose our two boba drinks: Royal Thai milk tea and a Jasmine Green latti with boba. After ordering, we went to sit in the comfortable sofas to wait for our food.

The drinks were brought out first. A latti just seemed like a regular boba drink, but we were pleased with the quality. However, someone in the group pointed out the tapioca balls were a bit chewer than usual.

Next, the spotlight desert! For all who don't know what raindrop desert ($3.50) is, it's a jiggly blob made out of mineral water and agar (the thing that gives it a Jell-O-like consistency). Since the cake itself has almost no taste, it's served alongside roasted soybean flour (kinako) and a sugary syrup called kuromitsu. When it was brought out to us, the girls instructed us to mix the flour and syrup together before eating. Thankfully they told us, because separately they were disgusting. After mixing the two to create a paste with the wooden spoons accompanying the desert, we dug in!

Don't expect any flavor from the cake itself. All the nutty, sweet flavor you will get is from the paste you create. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised! The flavor wasn't too overpowering. Since it was about the size of the palm of my hand, you really pay for the amount you get.

Would I drive all the way across town for sone Loftti? Not necessary. But would I come and stop by if I'm close by for some desert and boba? Why not!

I've been going here for awhile and I always love their drinks. However, this particular day that I went in, the customer service was horrible. First of all, as I approached the counter, the guy who was working was not welcoming at all. So I began greeting HIM and telling him my order. He then mumbled something to which I replied "what was that?" And in a rude and loud tone, he told me my total. I ordered a drink WITH boba which is also said in my receipt, but had no boba when I got it. So I went back to tell him that there was no boba in it, and he told me that I didn't ask for it. I showed him the receipt and he just stared at me. So I told him to add the boba and I'll just pay for it. No communication from him whatsoever. Fixed my order, but didn't apologize.

Really good coffee. LOVE the iced sea salt coffee. BUT why do you open so late??? I would love to go more often but by the time you're open I've already had my coffee. It really stinks so i come there only when I'm right by it rather than purposely going to get my morning coffee fix

Nice soft music and very relaxing. I got the Golden Medalist (strawberry and banana) made with real fruit, the smoothie was very refreshing! Service is very important to me, Tiffany was very polite and knowledgeable.
Great local spot for coffee or a tea!! I met a friend here for meeting and discovered it!! Great spot I wish they opened up earlier.
We tried the thai tea and the earl grey cotton candy. Both good! Im returning to try other flavors!

Decided to come here before dinner one night (Oh, didn't you know? Dessert before dinner is definitely the new norm for foodies like me lololol XD) since they were about to close in 30 mins at the time, and it was a week after opening. Needless to say I regret nothing because when I walked in I was genuinely surprised and delighted to be greeted by an adorable friend of mine actually working there whom I haven't seen in months (Hi Namhee~!! )! After having a cutesy moment of nostalgia, I asked her of their specialties, best sellers, and what she personally likes. 

I ended up getting the Blush Peach iced tea and Serena Honey fruity tea for drinks, and got the Earl Grey Cotton Candy shaved ice dessert to start my appetite for the night. Make sure to mix the shaved ice well or you won't be getting the full effect of the flavor. Blush Peach wasn't overtly diabeetus to me which is good since I barely drink iced teas. Serena Honey does well for those under the weather since it had honey and hints of ginger, but it wasn't overpowering in taste either. 

The ambiance of the cafe reminded me somewhat of Cafe Darak, but more earthly tones and neutral color schemes. Some of the trinkets made a nice touch to the overall atmosphere but it wasn't overbearing either. The background instrumentals were on point which gave the cafe a more subtle and tranquil feel so it could possibly be the next spot for students who like to study in cafes without so much distraction. I mean, I'm satisfied enough just coming here to drink, eat, and have memorable conservations with friends haha!

I ended up coming back in the following morning with good company and got the Scarlet and shared the Raindrop Dessert. A few of the coworkers remembered me from the previous night so yay! Scarlet ice tea was a nice deep shade of red and had a decent taste of blood orange in it, but surprisingly neither sour nor too sweet. I was able to finish this off pretty quickly lol. The Raindrop Dessert wasn't amazing, but its interesting to say the least. Make sure to mix the sauce til its moist before eating it with the raindrop-looking cake. It tasted like jello mixed with grounded graham crackers, which isn't bad but not exactly something I would eat repeatedly. I also had a few sips of my friends drinks, both being iced teas - Sun Drop and Emerald. Sun Drop was a bit too sweet to me but it almost tasted similar to Scarlet. Emerald intrigued me as it had yuzu, and I did enjoy the citrusy flavors that blended well together so I'll consider getting that next time. I haven't tried any of their milk teas or the rest of their cotton candy shaved ice but I definitely will in the near future! :D

This place is great, it's one that i really enjoy coming to. There's a specific drink I usually go there for and apparently only the manager is capable of making it for me?? I feel like its bc the other workers don't want to try to make it, which is a real bummer when you travel across town to go there...

Excellent drinks. Love the fruity black tea iced with green apple jellies. Cute atmosphere. Good service. Sometimes takes a little bit to get a drink made (10-20 minutes depending what your order) so definitely call ahead if you are in a rush. Good quality, and fair prices, makes this a 5 star rating.

What a cute cafe! I was immediately greeted by a sweet young woman who explained what the menu had to offer as I'd never been here before. I was waiting for a friend and decided to order a sandwich and a 16oz iced Carmel Latti. The sandwich wasn't bad and I enjoyed the buttery flavor the croissants provided. My drink was REALLY GOOD, like really good. It wasn't too sweet and I could taste as well as see the caramel. 

When my friend arrived, we ordered what we came here for: the rain drop cake. We personally did not like it. The flavor of the cake itself is a little bland and the soy flour and red bean syrup did not add any sweet qualities. 

Overall, I will be back. The drinks, customer service and atmosphere were amazing and I can't wait for my next visit to hopefully try the cotton candy shaved ice cream they have!!

I came in here just to stop by and check out the place, but the cotton candy shaved ice caught my eye. 

It was literally a shaved ice with cotton candy covering on the outside. The earl grey flavor was awesome where the ice had actually gotten the flavor. Def worth trying.

I came here the first time for the Raindrop dessert, which is so pretty looking. Instagram worthy.  I was excited to see that I could add Cotten Candy on top of my drink! Finally get to try that new trend~ even if it cost $1.50 to add it on top

A small little piece of Spring Mountain on Rainbow :') Loftti Cafe is a tiny Asian coffee/boba tea shop that seems to attract a lot of students. There is one large communal table (with hanging outlets!) and lots of 2 seater tables (with outlets!) The chairs are outdoor chairs and are surprisingly comfy for those long, long hours. 
For how many students there are studying here, their music is always really loud. My only complaint!
The honey black Loftti is your traditional milk tea. There milk teas are pretty good and light on the ice. 
Loftti is off on the side in the corner of the plaza and is a little hard to find. Park behind the Dairy Queen!

Where: Southwest corner of Rainbow & Robindale. Kind of hidden on the Robindale side behind the DQ.
