What: My family and I have tried ever single Latti (milk tea) on their menu and have narrowed down our favorites to the Jasmine Green and Macha. Generic I know... but they all of their drinks well. Sometimes a place might make their drinks too fast and the drink will be powdery or watery but Loffti Latti's are always perfect.

Why: The service we receive at Loffti is exceptional. The staff is so friendly. The fact that it's one of the closest "boba" cafe's to us is a big deal. We can pick up a drink on the way out before starting out errands or pick one up on the way home after a long day. The decor at Loffti is modern and inviting. The place is always spotless. I like the big huge table right in the front that invites people to sit together.

Thanks for being awesome Loffti!

We've driven by Loftti Cafe hundreds of times and we finally decided to stop in tonight. This place is really good. The girl behind the register saw the confusion on my face and explained the menu to us. 

We ended up ordering: 

BLUSH PEACH ICED TEA - (Green Tea, Peach, Rose)

GOLDEN LYCHEE ICED TEA - (Green Tea, Lychee, Ginger)

EARL GREY FROZEN COTTON CANDY - (Shaved Snow topped with cotton candy) This one was my fave.

ORIGINAL RAINDROP CAKE - Very interesting. But good! 

Giving this place 5 stars. Good service and a good menu! We'll definitely be back.

I really enjoy Loftti from the uniqueness of the interior to the drinks themselves. 

In terms of the decor, think of Loftti as the love child of a West Elm and a Crate & Barrel. They went for a glass pane kind of menu board and mid-century modern furniture, and besides the interior, the drinks and service were great! If you're here to study, they have hanging electrical outlets hanging above the large central table that you can just pull down. There's outlets next to the blue couch, and two others next to the bookcase in the back. The tables are kind of small which is the only downside if you're looking to study. But hey, it's a cafe and not a library, so I'll take it.

I didn't try the raindrop cake or the cotton candy dessert, but we had the hot americano and a 16oz white coconut latti (milk tea) instead. The americano was smooth and pretty tasty overall. They don't specialize in coffee, but if you're looking for a decent americano, you won't be disappointed. It comes with a high lid that is supposed to pool the coffee in the lid, and this is supposed to cool down the drink. I thought this was really novel and something I've never seen before.

The white coconut latti was amazing. I usually don't go for any other milk teas besides my usual (thai iced tea, jasmine milk tea, or almond milk tea), but I was feeling pretty zesty this weekend. This doesn't taste like an artificial coconut flavor but rather, it tastes like the real thing. It's got some density/slight creaminess to it, and it's a subtle coconut, not an overpowering flavor.

The customer service was great. She was very friendly and helpful when it came to choosing drinks since it was my first time. Overall, the employees are very nice.

All in all, the cafe is beautifully designed/decorated, the employees/staff are accommodating and friendly, and the drinks (especially the white coconut latti/milk tea) are great. 10/10 would come back if I didn't live so far away.

If you're not Asian and you don't have a laptop don't come here. I always hate going to a restaurant and it's only a certain type of ethnicity, makes me feel uncomfortable and out of place. The staff also looks at you like you're an alien.. I'm half Asian and white so don't worry I'm definitely not racist

Very cute place !!!
We tried their frozen cotton candy matcha. It was so delicious ! Not too sweet !!!
It's basically shaved ice with matcha powder, condensed milk and cotton candy !

When I first found out that Raindrop cake is finally in Las Vegas, I had to try it out for myself and see what the craze was all about. When I ordered the raindrop cake, I was so excited and thrilled of what it taste like. I ordered the cake and a Matcha green tea with boba.

For the cake, I was kinda disappointed?  It really does not taste like anything. Basically I am just tasting the syrup and the grain that they put in it, its just that. Nothing too fancy, nor new about it. It was not really that great so I guess I am not trying it out anytime soon. 

For the Matcha boba, it was good, okay. I kinda felt like there is too much powder that it did not blend well. They do have other interesting flavors that got me curious, something like with hibiscus, I would love to taste that next time. 

I will go back for the boba but I dont think I will for the cake.
First time to try this place out. Pistachio coffee for the win. Would definitely come back to try more of what they offer especially on desserts. Place is nice and simple.
This place is great. Cool vibe. Quality drinks and just a all around good place to kickback and chill

First time here since I moved to good 'ol LV. The ladies at the counter were helpful and patient with my indecisiveness. I finally ordered a blush peach drink w/ boba and dude ordered a salted Carmel drink. I will definitely be back to try others on the list. 

Ambience 10/10
Drinks 10/10
Service 10/10
Amaizing spot for cup of coffee. Love it! Free Wi-Fi, great location easy to access on 215 and rainbow. Staffs are super friendly. They have this loyalty program with your phone number.l

This is a hip new cafe with a different sort of vibe. Friendly customer service, delicious beverages, and cute seating (especially outside). 
Our go to spot for that bubble tea craving :)

On my quest to try every boba shop in Vegas, I would rank this place within the top 10 in the entire city. They have stiff competition considering they are located down the street from arguably the best boba tea shop in Vegas. I think this place does a good job standing out from the others. Their drinks are good and will "wow" anyone who has never tried it. 

I would feel more welcomed if the staff smiled and be more energetic instead of giving a mono-toned "how can I help you". Aside from that I would recommend this place to anyone who has never tried it.
Love all their drinks, especially the hot drinks perf for this weather  Try the Royal Thai and my most Fave Jasmin Green Latti

I was going to wait until my next visit to review when I try the raindrop dessert, but the Salted Caramel Frozen Latti was too good so I just had to write my review while I still have the taste of heaven in my mouth! As soon as I stepped inside the establishment, I could tell I was in for a treat. It was later at night and there was a family seated near the entrance, but the overall mood of the place was calm and relaxing. The menu is on the wall behind the counter and is basically broken into: hot tea, iced tea, frozen tea, fruit smoothies, shaved ice, and others.

I ordered the Salted Caramel frozen latti and Taro frozen latti. It took just a bit longer than anticipated for my drinks to be ready, but it seemed like only two women were working at the time, and the family before me were only starting to get their order. The women were very polite, as someone else on here mentioned. I asked if they make the raindrop dessert to-go, but sadly they don't; I couldn't try it on this visit due to time constraints. That's another reason for me to come back!

The salted caramel was pure heaven! I could taste notes of sweet caramel and, at other times, the saltiness. It was surprisingly not super sweet at all. I tasted the taro and it was just as yummy. I could taste the distinct flavor of taro which was not masked by an excess of sweetness. It also did not have that graininess you sometimes taste from the powdered mix. The 24oz is perfect for one person and you will most likely not want to share!

I think this will be my new boba spot from now on! I know another boba spot opened down the road from here, but I'll probably be coming to LOFTTI instead!

EDIT: The raindrop dessert was fantastic. They explained that you should swirl the powder and sauce in a circle around the raindrop and then eat it. All of the flavor comes from the sauce. During this visit I also got the honeydew frozen latti and the matcha frozen cotton candy. The honeydew was perfect. It had the perfect amount of sweetness which complemented the honeydew flavor so well. The frozen cotton candy is reminiscent of snow ice, but not nearly as thick and is very light in flavor. Everything is so yummy!

This place opened up across the street from where we live not too long ago, and it's a wonderful hole in the wall shop.  The employees are always friendly, great atmosphere, comfortable seating and internet/power.  I haven't had the food yet, but the drinks are all very good.  I have had many of the drinks, and haven't had a bad one yet!  Definitely recommend!

Out of all the boba shops and cafe's I've been to in Vegas, this is probably one of my top 5's.

The vibe you feel here is "different". Doesn't feel like just any cafe. 

I found it very easy to study here unlike many cafe's that leave you feeling unaccomplished due to noise, and many  other distractions.


+Ambience
+Service
+Drinks
+Service
+Cleanliness

-The location 
Can prove to be challenging if one is not familiar with the area, but isn't a issue now.

Didn't have a chance to try it but will order the raindrop, cotton candy dessert next time!

Will be back!

This place is a cute coffee shop hidden in southwest :) I like the set up & the decorations.. my only thing is, their drinks are a little too sweet for my liking. They have this cool dessert though with the cotton candy around it, kinda like the one you get from Anaheim Packing District. Their raindrop dessert is pretty cool in concept to eat but .. I wouldn't get it again

First time here with my boyfriend. We got the Lychee strawberry raindrop & raspberry herbal tea with blue raspberry cotton candy.  The raindrop was interesting & the tea taste like regular raspberry tea. We will be back to try the frozen latte. I can't wait!

I really like the ambiance and decor in this place. My friends and I were greeted as soon as we came in. The menu is written on the wall. It's a little hard to see at night cos there's a glare from the light on the wall. 

I don't remember the name of the tea I ordered but it was alright. It had hibiscus in it. It wasn't sweet, which I like. I also ordered the green tea raindrop dessert. I've been seeing it on social media & decided I had to try it. I guess because it was so hyped, my expectations were a little high. It wasn't bad but also wasn't as great as I thought it would be. The lady that handed us our order did teach us how the dessert should be eaten. The brown powdery stuff is supposed to be mixed with the syrup then eaten with the raindrop bubble thing. 

The ladies working were really nice! I imagine this is a place to get some work done or get some studying in so I'll probably be back.

Cotton candy fluff and snow desserts? Sign me up! This place is hip with the majority of the patrons on laptops and/or hanging out with friends. The server was courteous and suggested the early grey snow with the candy fluff. The snow itself with the earl grey tea was quite tasty. You definitely taste the earthy tea flavor and the sweetness level was just enough to qualify it as a dessert. The snow texture was super fine, so it melted easily upon eating. I enjoyed that aspect of the snow dessert.

The candy fluff was ok. It was not cloying sweet like most cotton candy, but it adds an extra texture to the melting snow in the dessert. Maybe better for taking pictures or wearing as a Santa beard as I did for fun. The wooden spoons are neat, but they were a weird shape so when you scooped the snow and ate it the spoon didn't glide smoothly empty. I would come back to try out their other flavors though.

Their iced jasmine green tea is THE BOMB. It actually tastes very much like jasmine, with no bitter artificial after taste. Their drinks are also cheaper and better than other cafes near by *no shade being thrown* and the interior is so cute!!! The only thing is that they have an ant problem idk if they're aware of it.

Very nice ambience, fair number of chairs, girls at the front are nice, welcomed us by saying "we've been waiting for you!" 

Got the white coconut Latti, kind of like a coconut Frappuccino. Pretty good! 

5 stars really for a nice, unobtrusive study space
Seriously the best drinks! Perfect for this hot Vegas weather. Great interior. Great atmosphere. I will definitely be coming here frequently!

Awesome spot to chill & study. Pretty cool desserts that I've never had before. Milk and green tea FROZEN cotton candy? It's dope. Wife ordered a raindrop thing, which was strange, but super cool. I recommend.

Excellent customer service. Love the design inside the café. They have great boba and desserts! The one dessert you need to try is their raindrop cake! Very instagram/snapchat worthy! The taste and experience is different from the others!
I like this place! Decor is nice, and staffs are friendly. They just started a loyalty program, so even better! :) I like their greentea raindrop cake and jasmine greentea loftti

This is one of the cutest cafes I have ever been to, which is saying a lot because I have been to countless amounts of cafes in Nevada/California/Illinois. It is calm and quiet, but has a good, constant flow of people coming in and out. This place is known for its unique menu items such as the raindrop cake (a gelatin dessert that you mix with either a mix of sauces or soy flour) and the frozen cotton candy (very finely, almost powdery-soft shaved ice flavored in a variety of tea flavors topped with a large mound of cotton candy). Both were very interesting treats that satisfied my inner foodie. I also loved that they had so many delicious flavored iced  tea combinations such as the emerald (green tea, yuzu, mint, and green apple) which were all very reasonably priced. Although it is far from my house, I look forward to my next visit to this cafe.

Cool small little place around the corner. Menu is fairly small so its not very overwhelming. Good Vibes, mellow music. Its a spot for students who's trying to do a little group study and everything. Earl Grey and Matcha shaved ice with cotton candy on top of good and so as the raindrop desserts.

I tried taro latti 
So good 

So many drinks to choose from
I had hard time choosing one

Definitely perfect place to stop by

Definitely a place worth checking out!

I've been here twice already, and each visit has been great. I've tried the scarlet iced tea, which is quite refreshing on a hot summer day, and the jasmine tea latti, which is my personal favorite. I've also sampled the white coconut slush, which tasted really good too (and I'm not that big of a fan of coconut). Overall, their drinks taste very rich, and the prices for their items are very reasonable. This place is a great study spot to get schoolwork done and place to catch up with friends. The first time I came here, my drink was full of ice, so if you prefer less ice in your drinks like me, make sure to specify that you would like less ice in your drink. The staff is very friendly and accommodating.

I literally love this place so much. It's a great place to do homework with ample charger plugs, great drinks, and a great vibe. There was a second in time where I went almost every day to study and when school starts up in the fall I will sure be here once again. My all time favorite cafe to study and hangout at, especially since it's so close to my house. I have no idea why I didn't update to 5 stars months ago!
My recommendations: jasmine green milk tea, earl grey milk tea, early grey frozen cotton candy, and the blush peach signature iced tea.
Yo the tea here is straight fucking fire. I have never tasted Emma Watson's piss before but I'd imagine it taste like the drinks here: refreshing, a nice shade of gold, and magical.

Get the frozen cotton candy!!!! I had the earl grey one and it was so amazing I wanted to get another one. Also tried the raindrop dessert. It looked super fun but was less tasty than the frozen cotton candy. It was basically a big ball of mochi that you dip in coffee(ish) flavored sauce and powder to give it some flavor. Also I had the Thai milk tea which was a lot more milky than normal Thai tea but it was delicious! Very fun coffee shop definitely will be back to try more goodies

This was one of those places that will keep you coming back. My first visit I had gotten the golden lychee. While I waited(quick service), I looked around at the interior and noticed how clean and modern it looked. If you have the opportunity to stop by, give it a shot because you won't regret it.

Raindrop dessert is here in Vegas! This little, clear, gelatinous boob...er...blob is served with a brown sugary syrup and a nutty, roasted sesame powder. It's a little weird, but I'm all for the opportunity to try something new. All components should be together, if eaten separately it's kind of unpalatable. *Cough* Don't be like me and choke on the powder. 

If you're looking for a caffeine buzz you probably won't find it here. They offer teas, blended drinks, lattis (not espresso based), and smoothies. The only coffee is an Americano. Boba can be added to your drink.  I enjoyed a taro frozen latti and a white coconut frozen latti. It was a nice sweet, non-caffeinated treat. 

I didn't get a chance to try the frozen cotton candy on my first visit, but will order it next time!

The ladies at the counter were sweet, helpful and I was impressed with their customer service. There is a complimentary self serve water, which is always a plus at a cafe that offers sweets. There is a also a small area for utensils, napkins, and simple syrup. Just in case, you want to add some sweetness to your drink! 

*****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge*****
42/100

Love this place and love the Milk Tea Boba here. I had order the Boba Milk Tea less sugar with Boba. They have a lot of seat places to hang out and free wifi. Good for business meeting and hang out with friend.
Went in to buy my wife a boba.  People were very nice and were fast with my order.  They also have Apple Pay , big bonus in my book.  I'm going to keep coming back

I'm not sure what I think of this place yet but I probably won't be coming back, 4 Stars because the drink I had was super delicious: SCARLET ICED TEA and the service was great. This place seems unique in its style and drink specialty or maybe I'm not used to the Asian drink vibe South of 215. Walking in me and my friend thought about walking back out as the ambience was quiet, tooooo quiet. And we are anything but.... I was just too curious about the RAIN DROP CAKES, so I ordered a GREEN TEA rain drop cake. I'm not a fan, this whole soybean, powdery, gelatin substance you're expected to mix just isn't doin it for me, but it sure looks cool. And it's certainly a refreshing treat for a hot summer day.

This place gives off chill vibes and its one of those coffee shops where u can just relax and enjoy a good coffee. They also are the only one in Vegas who serve Raindrop Cakes. If you go here, you should definitely try the Raindrop dessert

Loftti Cafe may be my new go to spot to study! The place is spacious, with cute decor, a comfy couch, and outdoor seating too! The cashier was super sweet and knowledgeable. I ordered the Matcha frozen latti and let me tell you...it was thee best I ever had! Everything was blended to perfection!!!! I'll be back often, that's for sure.

Bam! Four stars and not five- I would love my single shot of espresso before the 11:30am opening time!
Great location and love the indoor seating, the outdoor seating and the paper roll on the wall for doodling!
Yes, the lovely young lady who is there when it opens is exceptional.  I've arrived earlier than opening and she's always more than willing in providing me with my single shot and that chocolate chip muffin!  
Fresh, good quality chocolate- make sure you have it warmed up!
Now, that drink with the cotton candy- OH MY!  Yes, it's a must.  Particularly if you have a sweet tooth as I do. 
Oddly enough, I do not put any sweetener or sugar in my espresso. 
I've tried a variety of the teas here as well, please go ahead and inquire about them all are great and I have not been suggested one yet, which I have not enjoyed!

Been coming here at least once a week, mainly because it's midterms. Parking is sometimes hard to find. You know it's busy, when you see a car parked in the white no parking zone. I would have to say that this is one of my favorite boba joints in Las Vegas. They usually play Korean music and instrumental songs. The vibe here I would say is quite different. Their ambience/lighting is not too dark like some other places. They have ceiling plugs that pull down and a decent amount of studying space if you plan to go there and study for an hour or more.

I have tried the shaved ice in Jasmine flavor topped with Strawberry cotton candy and enjoyed it! They have different types of drinks available. The mango/strawberry smoothie tastes a bit like Jamba's Strawberries Wild. I have the tried the raindrop (actually looks like a big raindrop on your plate), which is like gelatin. The raindrop is alright but it is a must try if it's your first time there. Flavored teas are good. I have tried the Honey Black Tea and that's one of my favorites.

This cafe is unique in its menu such as the frozen Cotton candy. It's like a frozen latte inside the cup surrounded with cotton candy. The earl gray and the green tea matcha are favorites. (The last time I went the machine was broken so now I always call before hehe!)

The green tea frozen latte is also a favorite of mine. It's not over sweet compared to Starbucks and it's a good portion (possibly 20oz) for the same price as the Starbucks tall size. My husband likes the earl gray frozen latte and it's pretty great as well.

They also have the cool raindrop cake. So if one has never had this cake what would it taste like... literally it taste like non flavored jello but it comes with various of "sauces" which then flavors it. It's cool to try once but since I have... I don't see myself ever ordering it.

All in all I love this cafe!

Super friendly and relaxing cafe. I dig the raindrop cake. It's not super sweet, so if you're having a sweet tooth, I would not recommend. It's more of gelatin thing with light fruit and two different types of sauces. Tried the strawberry. I'll try green tea next time.

Loftti has the raindrop dessert?! 

My friends and I actually came here the first or second week of their opening just because I wanted to try their dessert. I've seen this dessert in a restaurant in NYC and have been wanting to try it!

The location of Loftti is where Monster Café used to be at I believe. It's kinda in a weird spot -- tucked to the side of the plaza. Once you walk in, the colors and decors give off a very vintage yet modern feel. They have a couch in the middle and an abstract bookcase by the back. 

Aside from the raindrop dessert, I decided to try out their frozen salted caramel latti while my friend tried their coconut latti. Their salted caramel latti was actually quite good. It had tinges of saltiness at the end of the drink after the sweetness has hit you. It wasn't overly cavity causing sweet, and I appreciate that greatly. My friend was only so-so on his coconut latti. It was a huge heavy coconut flavor to it ... almost seems artificial. 

As for the raindrop dessert .. well, there isn't much to say with that. It does come with roasted sesame powder and brown syrup. The dessert itself is just flavorless jelly. It's made with gelatin and agave so .. really, you're just tasting the powder and the syrup. Not that great and not something I would get again. It was fun to poke it and jiggle it around though. 

Overall, an okay place. I can't say that I'm in love. I also can't say that they have anything for me to keep coming back for. But I think it'd be nice to hang out here.

Loftti is a cute little cafe. The boba was nice and chewy, but I really wasn't a fan of their drink. I ordered Tropical Green, and there was nothing tropical about it. It tasted so bland. 

I ordered it with fluff because it was my first time there, and I of course had to "do it for the gram (yelp)"
I'll probably opt for a different boba place next times

So I totally had to check this place out! I've been hearing nothing but great things about it and truth be told it was well worth the wait! They have the cutest decor and the most delicious drinks! I'm not a big fan of cotton candy but it was really tasty ( I have a pretty big sweet tooth)! I came here for a cute little date and totally fell in love with it after hearing so many great things about it. Will definitely be coming back!

This staff is super friendly and their drinks are very delicious. I had the fruity black tea and a raindrop or tear drop cake. I forget the exact name. It was a very interesting and fun dessert to try.

really delicious boba, unique sweet flavors. i like the inside of this place as well. it's very clean and modern.
tried the raindrop cake, both flavors! i preferred the original. definitely a food experience unlike any other in las vegas. if you're a foodie, go just to try.

Service is great. Staff was very helpful in recommending drinks and even provided a phone charger for us. They have multiple wall outlets for charging electronics and they also have outlets that pull down from the ceiling at their bigger table seating. Ordered the green tea and the black sugar raindrop dessert. I expected it to taste amazing but it had a very powdery taste that I didn't like kinda tasted like how a protein drink does. The honey black latti was good a little bit too sweet. And the boba was one of the best I've had here in Vegas. Will try and stop by again and try the other menu items.

Loftti is definitely a place worth going to! If you're looking for a quiet cafe so you can get some work done, then this is definitely the place for you! The music selection also gives me a sense of comfort and perfects the cafe's overall environment. Loftti reminds me of a very modern place from the way the place is decorated to the amazing customer service the workers provide! I definitely recommend you to try it! You will not be disappointed!!

Lofti Cafe is a wonderful place to visit for delicious drinks that you can top off with sweet cotton candy "clouds". They're also the only place I know of that does Japanese raindrop cakes! 

The cafe itself is gorgeous and clean. It was a great place for me and my friends to get a few study hours in. They had it decorated for halloween and they totally got me with the bathroom scare. 

I will definitely be coming back and maybe I'll try their shaved ice or sandwiches. You must visit this place!
This cafe is very cute and so hipster!! I love the ambience of this place and I find it peaceful/relaxing to study here. Their drinks are delicious too and my personal favourite is their taro latti!!

Came here on a Sunday afternoon and we were the only customers, considering this place has just opened up. I came here after a few recommendations, and was excited to try their raindrop dessert. While browsing through the menu, they took the time to explain to us what each of the items were..essentially latti is milk tea, frozen latti is ice blended, and cotton candy is shaved ice. We ordered an iced matcha latti, iced taro latti with boba, and the raindrop dessert. I usually don't like any matcha lattes/milk teas when the matcha powder is overpowering and makes the drink very grainy. But this one was one of the best matcha milk teas I've had in town. It was just slightly grainy but just about the right amount for you to know it was made with real matcha powder. Not too sweet at all but very full and flavorful. I tried my friend's taro latti and it was equally good, and the boba isn't too sweet on its own to overpower the milk tea. I've never had the raindrop dessert before so I don't have a previous experience to compare this one with. But it's a very good dessert, especially for the price of $3.25, and overall a fun experience that is definitely worth trying. 

We sat on the couch against the wall facing the glass windows. It's a very comfortable and welcoming space and I can definitely see myself getting work done here. Where the couch is located, you can't actually see the counter where the drinks are served, allowing a pleasant sense of privacy. There is a larger study table toward the middle, and smaller and more intimate tables toward the back, where there is also a wall of magazines (of mostly interior architecture/design, which I have no complaints about). The service was great, a very friendly staff.

I like everything this place offers, but only wish they served coffee. The only coffee item on their menu is Americano, and if there was a bigger selection of coffees I think I would definitely come here even more often than I will. Perhaps this is more of a dessert-drinks type of cafe, but I think if they offered coffee they would attract even more customers, because their drinks are already great. Loved it, would definitely come back!

I've been here quite a few times already. It's now one of my favorites and among my top three boba places/cafes to go to in Vegas. I'd say it's on par with Kung Fu Tea; the difference is in the consistency of their milk teas, in which Loftti's has a creamy consistency. 

It's definitely a great place to go to if you want pastries/desserts to go with your drinks, as their desserts are pretty tasty. I always come back for their honey black milk tea and banana nut muffins, and those raindrops don't disappoint either. Definitely a place I'd recommend to take the time to check out.
Great location and very relaxing outdoor seating area.  They do carry almond milk which is awesome due to my wife being dairy sensitive.

The drink I had gotten tasted like completely milk, and not good milk. My friend got something completely different and his wasn't good either. Afterwards we both were not feeling good so we ended up leaving. The place is cute and I love th cotton candy idea but the drinks aren't worth it...

If I ever opened a cafe business this would be it. Loftti cafe has the best drinks to offer. I ordered the emerald tea from yelps references, and ordered the honey black tea from the lady's recommendation. Also with their today's special of the raindrop dessert. I was very impress on everything we had. My emerald tea was very refreshening, and the honey black tea holds plenty of flavor. The ambience is a best place to just socialize or catchup on some studying. 

Customer service was very excellent, and well mannered towards their customers. Definitely will be a new go-to spot when I get the cravings for boba.
Would like to try their frozen cotton candy next time and smoothies. Hopefully sooner or later they will have stamp cards. Come to loftti café !!!!!! :D

Went here not too long ago and has a great experience! We were welcomed in by the staff and they were very attentive towards us and helped us when needed. 

The interior is cute and has a lot of seats. It looks like a great place to do homework and or study at. 

I got the raindrop dessert and for the price, it's satisfying. The kinako and red bean sauce really helps! I also got an iced tea which I believe was called sun drop? It was very refreshing and super cheap. The whole menu is actually pretty affordable and pretty unique which is a plus. 

Still need to check out a couple of drinks and their frozen cotton candy. Hoping they might use a stamp card system soon as well, but that's just my preference. Other than that this place is great!

Loftti café is a nice little spot, not crowded, and great for studying. I like the large table in the middle, makes great for laptop and study sessions. I went here for a business meeting. They have a good selection of drinks. I had the iced pomegranate oolong tea and I was satisfied. Very refreshing, it did take rather long to get the drink. 

The outside patio is also a nice touch that offers more privacy. Although I enjoyed this place, I don't see myself coming back unless invited.
The raindrop is so cute! Dessert but not too over sweet!  So good for summer!  Golden lychee ice tea is awesome too!  Ice tea with fresh lychee favor!

I've been here a few times to study and overall I've had a great experience. 

Food/drinks: I tried the rainbow matcha cake. It was my first time having rainbow cake so I wasn't sure what to expect. However, I liked the jelly texture and the matcha powder went with it kind of well. If you don't like straight up matcha though, I wouldn't recommend it. I've also had iced coffee there too, but I feel like it's on the weaker side. 

Service: they're all really friendly, asking if you want to join the loyalty program. Drinks comes out pretty fast. 
Wifi is also fast which is essential for me. 

Atmosphere: it's a little too dark inside which strains my eyes when I'm working there too long. The best lighting you get is at the communal table or next to the window. The vibe is very antique-hipster-like with the decor and the customers' drawn art on the door.
I like their Latti drinks. My favorite is Royal Thai. My only complaint is they use so much ice.
black milk tea is pretty good. I gave them 3 stars cuz they wont let me allow to bring my sandwich in.

This cafe is small and cozy. The girl who helped me was very nice and recommended me the sundrop tea when i asked for something sweet and I  actually really liked it. After I sat down she even came by my table to give me a tea sample! I appreciate that kind of customer service! Also the drinks are SO cheap like under $3. Im coming back to try more teas and that famous raindrop cake :P

In the same plaza as Dairy Queen, Rainbow & Robindale (southwest corner). 

Friendly staff and service. Menu is very simple, although you might have to ask what some of their stuff are but they are more than willing to educate you. On my first visit she asked me if we've been here before and then proceeded to explain their menu. Latti are their milk tea. Cotton candy is their shaved ice. It's in a small cup and it's pretty great. They have 4 flavors of that, and I've tried milk (condensed milk pretty much), coffee, and earl grey. I liked all of them. Will be trying their matcha flavor next time I'm in.

Their raindrop dessert is what's got all the people wanting to come in (at least for me) since it's so appealing visually. It's not anything to go crazy for, in terms of taste, but it's fun to get. The brown powder is roasted soybean powder, I believe, and depending if you get regular or green tea, that's their sauce. I've tried both and they're pretty decent.

I've yet to try their Latti as all I've had was their hot jasmine green tea. So far so good for everything. Their tables are pretty small (and round) except for their one big table as you enter the cafe, but the seats are kind of spaced out. This place is pretty good if you're coming with maybe one other friend or by yourself to work on stuff. Wouldn't really recommend coming here with a big group.

Came in and ordered the strawberry raindrop dessert. The strawberry syrup was really refreshing but the chocolate sauce they used was the cheap kind. Price is considered cheaper than other cafes I've been to so I'll come back to try the Lattis next time. Great selection of music though!

If you're going to Loftti, I recommend trying the Earl Grey Milk Tea. Out of all the milk teas my friend and I have tried in Vegas, this one is our favorite, and it will probably stay that way for a while. Along with the milk tea, we also tried the rain drop cake that they had. The rain drop cake itself doesn't actually have any taste, it's like a bland piece of jello. However, they were innovative in adding strawberry slices and serving it with chocolate syrup. This makes the dessert somewhat more refreshing than it could've been without the strawberry and the chocolate. One of their specialties is the cotton candy cloud as a topping for your drink. The cotton candy is not too sweet, so if you want to try something different this can add some fun to your drink. The place is also very quiet. If you are looking for a place to study while sipping your boba, try going to Loftti.

Cute lil cafe on the corner of Robindale and Rainbow. Kind of hard to get to, but definitely worth the drive. Been here a few times and it's always been busy. I like the blended drinks. We've tried mocha, oreo, and coconut. All three of which have been delicious, and I don't like coconut so that's saying a lot. They are very friendly and make sure your order is made how you like it. If you want to try something new, I'd definitely suggest this place!

I've been here several times now and I think it's time for a review. Honestly I think this is my new favorite boba shop on this side of town besides Brew Tea bar. I love the vibe you get when you walk in. There's some nice Kpop music playing and the employees greet you once you walk in. I'm a huge fan of there Honey Black milk tea with boba. Definitely coming back here to study and chill with friends! 

There is a downside here but it doesn't affect my rating to this place. The location is a bit small so it does tend to get packed and parking can be a problem. I remember having to park further down just to find a free parking spot. Otherwise this place is really worth stopping by and checking out!

I love that Rainbow is turning into the new Spring Mtn! Now I can find all these fun places down the street from my house. 

I had to try the frozen cotton candy which I believe is just shaved ice with a huge cotton candy topping-we did the Earl Grey. It was great, light, and not nearly as sweet as I imagined. 

I also tried the jasmine iced latte. Perfection  I love that nothing is overpowered by sweetness like most the boba places I have tried. Looks are usually deceiving-not here! 

We will be back!!

Came here with my roommates because we were down the street and saw some yelp reviews saying that it was a great place to go to. The ambience was nice when you walk in and they have comfy looking couches and a cool table set in front of the door. We asked the cashier what he recommended and he kinda laughed and asked us what we meant by that. So we rephrased our question which I thought was very straight forward and very strange for someone to answer a question back with another question. He suggested the raindrop cake because he said the flavor tasted like strawberries and the golden lychee for a drink because that's how favorite and it also had great lychee flavor to it. So we took his suggestions and ordered them both. We were disappointed in his suggestions because both were not up to par with what he said. The rainbow cake was tasteless and although when you got to the strawberry it did taste like strawberry that was the only flavor in this cake but you'd expect the strawberry fruit to taste like strawberry right? Anyway the golden lychee had a green tea flavor but barely any lychee flavor to it. Not sure if we'd come in to try this place again as the service was okay and the items that were suggested to us came out disappointing.
